titleproper.value:
Guide to the Walter Lowenfels' A Poet's Petition: Letter to the President in the Form of a Cantata for a Narrator and Two Voices with Film Strip or Slides [typescript]
                    <num>TAM.474</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Peter Filardo

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T19:48-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Walter Lowenfels: A Poet's petition, letter to the President in the form of a cantata for a narrator and two voices with film strip or slides [typescript]

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Derived from the guide to a collection of Walter Lowenfels' papers at Washington University, St. Louis. http://library.wustl.edu/units/spec/manuscripts/mlc/lowenfels</item>
                </list>

Consists of one typescript, a poem in cantata form, addressed to the President of the United States, discussing the danger of nuclear war, and national and world social and political issues, in a manner reflective of Lowenfels' radicalism, including an invocation of Patrice Lumumba.
